lexUnit.name: heartbroken.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: suffering from overwhelming distress; very upset.

sentence.text: You must have been heartbroken . "
When Annie 's daughter died at the age of five , she was heartbroken .
A heartbroken Daniels watched this all going on , and was moved to break the golden rule of not speaking until spoken to .
Heartbroken , Maria had to return to the convent and remain a nun for the rest of her life .
` I am heartbroken because football has been my whole life . "
Heartbroken Tim Godwin weeps as he tells how he had to tell his 23-month-old daughter Sophie : ` Mummy is n't coming back " .
She crammed more living into her 30 years than most people experience in two lifetimes , according to her heartbroken parents Ken and Diana .
She regarded the wife of former Beirut hostage Jackie Mann as a ` dear friend' and was heartbroken she could not see her before she died of lung cancer on November 30 .
YEOVIL TOWN captain Mark Shail was heartbroken last night over the rash moment which may cost him the chance of playing in the dream FA Cup tie against Arsenal .
The kids will be heartbroken .
Britt is heartbroken that her eight-year marriage to toyboy husband ` Slim " Jim McDonnell , 31 , is to end in divorce .
She was heartbroken to hear the voice of Camilla .
And yesterday his heartbroken wife Jane slammed police for failing to find him after she raised the alarm 48 hours earlier .
Yesterday the heartbroken teenager , who was on the verge of trials with the Royal Ballet , said : ` In just one second , my life has been wrecked .
THE heartbroken mother of transplant donor Paula Moss is leaving England to work as a missionary .
She 'd be heartbroken if her father was n't at her wedding .

Only afterwards , when Tommy disappeared and Maudie seemed so heartbroken , then I began to wonder .

Although I have has a lot of support , I feel heartbroken about Henri 's future .

Surely someone somewhere knows who killed Ann Heron and that person could ease the pain for her heartbroken family .
